concept.title: Object Snap settings
concept.shortdesc: If you need to use one or more object snaps repeatedly, you can turn on running object snaps on the Grid and Snap tab of Drafting Settings dialog box. The object snap mode keeps on unless you turn it off. For example, you can use an object snap to draw a line to the center of a circle.

conbody.p: If several objects snap on, the system chooses automatically the most suitable object snap. If there are two possible object snaps at the selection area, the system chooses the one that is closer to the center of target box.

If you turn several object snaps on, you need to check which one is in effect when you specify a point. If several object snaps are eligible at a given location, press the TAB key to cycle through the possibilities before you specify the point.
